qas.question: What hypothesis tries to explain the increased amount of asthma world wide?
How does the hygiene hypothesis explain the increase in asthma?

answers.text: a direct and unintended result of reduced exposure, during childhood, to non-pathogenic bacteria and viruses

qas.question: What has caused the reduced exposure in childhood?

answers.text: increased cleanliness and decreased family size in modern societies
Exposure to bacterial endotoxin in early childhood

qas.question: What is some of the evidence backing the hygiene hypothesis?

answers.text: lower rates of asthma on farms and in households with pets.

qas.question: What hypothesis explains the increased rates of viruses worldwide?

plausible_answers.text: a direct and unintended result of reduced exposure, during childhood, to non-pathogenic bacteria and viruses

qas.question: How does the hygene hypothesis explain the cause of bronchoconstriction?

plausible_answers.text: Exposure to bacterial endotoxin in early childhood

qas.question: What can cause bacteria in pets?

plausible_answers.text: increased cleanliness and decreased family size in modern societies

qas.question: Why are people less likely to want to live on a farm?

plausible_answers.text: lower rates of asthma on farms and in households with pets

qas.question: What is some evidence used to support the hypothesis on non-pathogenic bacteria?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>The hygiene hypothesis<b5_0/><a0_0/> attempts to explain the increased rates of asthma worldwide as <a1_0><b6_0>a direct and unintended result of reduced exposure, during childhood, to non-pathogenic bacteria and viruses<b6_0/><a1_0/>. It has been proposed that the reduced exposure to bacteria and viruses is due, in part, to <a2_0><b8_0>increased cleanliness and decreased family size in modern societies<b8_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0><b7_0>Exposure to bacterial endotoxin in early childhood<b7_0/><a3_0/> may prevent the development of asthma, but exposure at an older age may provoke bronchoconstriction. Evidence supporting the hygiene hypothesis includes <a4_0><b9_0>lower rates of asthma on farms and in households with pets<b9_0/>.
